packages.name: forgekeeper
packages.docstring:
Forgekeeper (v2 default)

This lightweight package routes the Forgekeeper CLI and module entrypoint
to the v2 orchestrator implementation.

modules.docstring: Lightweight logging helpers for Forgekeeper.

functions.name: get_logger
functions.docstring:
Return a configured logger instance.

The logger is cached per ``name`` and initialised with a simple formatter on
first use. Additional calls return the cached logger so repeated setup is
avoided.

packages.name: forgekeeper-v2.forgekeeper_v2
packages.docstring:
Forgekeeper v2 package – Thoughtworld Orchestrator.

Modules:
- orchestrator: runtime, policies, events, adapters
- memory: summaries and facts storage
- ui: FastAPI server to stream events

packages.docstring: Memory plane utilities: summarizer and facts store.

classes.name: LLMTriton
classes.docstring:
Triton Inference Server adapter for local OSS models (e.g., 20B).

- Requires `tritonclient[http]` unless FK_TRITON_FAKE_RESPONSE is set.
- Configure with TRITON_URL (http://localhost:8000), TRITON_MODEL (oss-20b).
- Input/Output defaults INPUT_0/OUTPUT_0 can be overridden via env.

classes.name: DefaultOrchestratorConfig
classes.docstring:
Helper for assembling :class:`Orchestrator` dependencies.

The core orchestrator accepts fully constructed contract objects.  This
configuration class centralises the default wiring so production code and
tests can easily opt into the stock ``LLMMock`` strategies, JSONL-backed
recorders, and tool routing without coupling the orchestrator itself to
specific implementations.

modules.name: forgekeeper.core.orchestrator.contracts
modules.docstring: Contracts describing orchestrator dependencies and helper factories.

classes.name: LLMEndpoint
classes.docstring:
Protocol implemented by language-model endpoints used by the orchestrator.

The orchestrator expects streaming generation where each yielded chunk is a
``(text, act)`` tuple.  Providers should emit activity notifications through
their ``TriggerPolicy`` (see :class:`PolicyProvider`) when non-``THINK`` acts
are produced so scheduling heuristics remain accurate.

classes.name: ToolRouter
classes.docstring: Protocol responsible for lifecycle management of registered tools.

classes.name: MemoryEntry
classes.docstring:
Structured representation of a persisted memory entry.

The dataclass intentionally mirrors the JSON payload produced by the
legacy episodic memory module while also retaining arbitrary metadata via
``extra``. Consumers can build instances manually or rely on
:meth:`from_payload` for conversion from dictionaries loaded from disk.

classes.name: MemoryBackend
classes.docstring: Protocol describing the required memory backend behaviour.

functions.name: register_memory_backend
functions.docstring:
Register ``factory`` under ``name``.

Parameters
----------
name:
    Unique backend identifier.
factory:
    Callable that instantiates and returns a :class:`MemoryBackend`.
replace:
    If ``False`` (default), attempting to register a duplicate name raises
    :class:`ValueError`.

functions.docstring: Return the names of registered backends in registration order.

functions.name: get_memory_backend

classes.name: JsonlMemoryReader
classes.docstring:
Utility responsible for reading memory entries from a JSONL file.

The reader caches the parsed entries using the file's ``mtime`` and size as
a simple invalidation signal. The cache keeps behaviour deterministic while
avoiding redundant JSON decoding when the file has not changed between
calls.

classes.name: JsonlMemoryBackend
classes.docstring: Persist episodic memories into a JSONL file with fsync semantics.

functions.name: _migrate_from_state_if_needed
functions.docstring: If goals.json is missing, try to migrate from state['active_goals'].

functions.name: load_goals
functions.docstring: Load all goals from disk (or migrate from state if file missing).

functions.name: save_goals
functions.docstring: Persist the given goals list to disk.

functions.name: get_active_goals
functions.docstring: Return descriptions of currently active goals.

functions.name: add_goal
functions.docstring:
Add a new goal and return its identifier.

Parameters
----------
description:
    The textual description of the goal or subtask.
source:
    A label indicating where the goal originated.
parent_id:
    If provided, the goal is treated as a subtask of ``parent_id``.
priority:
    Ordering hint used when scheduling subtasks. Higher values denote
    earlier execution preference.
depends_on:
    List of goal identifiers that must be completed before this goal.

functions.name: deactivate_goal
functions.docstring: Mark the goal with ``goal_id`` as inactive. Return True if found.

standalone_modules.name: scripts.infer_cli
standalone_modules.docstring:
Simple CLI for querying a vLLM OpenAI-compatible endpoint.

The script sends a chat completion request with the provided prompt
and prints the first completion text. By default the target endpoint is
read from ``FK_CORE_API_BASE`` (falling back to ``http://localhost:8001``),
but can be overridden with ``--base-url``.

functions.name: _normalize_base_url
functions.docstring: Ensure the base URL contains the ``/v1`` prefix expected by OpenAI APIs.

standalone_modules.name: scripts.mqtt_forgekeeper_listener
standalone_modules.docstring:
MQTT listener for Forgekeeper tasks.

Connects to a local broker, subscribes to ``forgekeeper/task``, decodes JSON
instructions, and publishes simple acknowledgements on ``forgekeeper/status``.

functions.name: process_forgekeeper_message
functions.docstring:
Stub handler for Forgekeeper messages.

Currently logs the incoming message and publishes a simple acknowledgement
to the Forgekeeper status topic. Future implementations may perform actions
such as loading files, summarising, editing, and sending richer status
updates.

standalone_modules.name: scripts.update_file_summary
standalone_modules.docstring: Regenerate `FILE_SUMMARY.md` with a one-line summary for each tracked file.

functions.name: git_tracked_files
functions.docstring: Return a sorted list of tracked file paths relative to repo root.

functions.name: first_line
functions.docstring: Return the first line of a file, or note if binary/empty.

standalone_modules.name: scripts.update_requirements
standalone_modules.docstring:
Lock top-level dependencies in requirements.txt to exact versions.

The script reads package names from ``requirements.txt`` and writes them
back with the versions currently installed in the environment.  Use this
after upgrading packages to refresh the pinned versions.

Legacy Git committer test shim.

This file remains for backwards compatibility. All tests have moved to
`tests/git_committer/` modules and are imported here so that running
`pytest tests/test_git_committer.py` still executes the split tests.

standalone_modules.docstring: Apply labels to the current pull request based on `tasks.md` metadata.

standalone_modules.name: tools.nav.build_module_index
standalone_modules.docstring:
Build a repository-wide index of Python packages and modules.

This script walks the repository, skipping large vendor directories such as
``node_modules`` and typical cache folders. It inspects each Python package and
module, capturing module docstrings as well as top-level class and function
summaries. The collected data is written to both a machine-readable JSON file
and a human-friendly Markdown document.

Usage
-----
    python tools/nav/build_module_index.py [--root PATH]

By default the script assumes it lives inside ``tools/nav`` and walks the
repository root two directories above its location. Use ``--json-output`` and
``--markdown-output`` to override the destinations of the generated files.

classes.name: DefinitionSummary
classes.docstring: Description of a top-level class or function.

classes.name: ModuleSummary
classes.docstring: Summary of a Python module.

classes.name: PackageSummary
classes.docstring: Summary of a Python package.

functions.name: short_doc
functions.docstring: Return a single-line summary for Markdown output.

functions.name: parse_python_file
functions.docstring: Parse a Python module and capture its docstrings.

standalone_modules.name: tools.smoke_backend
standalone_modules.docstring:
Run a simple backend smoke test.

Builds the backend, starts the server, probes the /health endpoint, and
asserts an HTTP 200 response before shutting the server down.

If the backend directory, npm, or node are missing, the test is skipped.
